name: Cultural Exchange
text: Choose any number of creatures target player controls. Choose the same number of creatures another target player controls. Those players exchange control of those creatures. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

name: Cumber Stone
text: Creatures your opponents control get -1/-0.

editions.flavor:
"The stone is more potent than ever. The flesh that creeps into our land will become even more slovenly and weak."
—Niclavs, archmage of Esper

name: Cunning
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
When enchanted creature attacks or blocks, sacrifice Cunning at the beginning of the next cleanup step.

editions.flavor:
". . . Dry-walkers die
We feed on sweet flesh . . . ."
—Rootwater Saga

name: Cunning Advisor
text: {T}: Target opponent discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

name: Cunning Bandit
text:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Cunning Bandit.
At the beginning of the end step, if there are two or more ki counters on Cunning Bandit, you may flip it.

name: Cunning Breezedancer
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, Cunning Breezedancer gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"That which is beautiful in form can also be deadly."
—Ishai, Ojutai dragonspeaker

name: Cunning Giant
text: If Cunning Giant is unblocked, you may have it assign its combat damage to a creature defending player controls.

name: Cunning Lethemancer
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, each player discards a card.

editions.flavor: "Give me your memories, and you will have release from the suffering they bring you."

name: Cunning Sparkmage
text:
Haste
{T}: Cunning Sparkmage deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: "I see the weaknesses you hide even from yourself."

name: Cunning Strike
text:
Cunning Strike deals 2 damage to target creature and 2 damage to target player.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"The opponent who blocks the path, becomes the path."
—Shu Yun, the Silent Tempest

name: Cunning Wish
text: You may choose an instant card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Exile Cunning Wish.

editions.flavor: The foolish wish for that which they desire. The cunning wish for that which they require.
He wished for knowledge, but not for the will to apply it.

name: Cuombajj Witches
text: {T}: Cuombajj Witches deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to target creature or player of an opponent's choice.

name: Curator of Mysteries
text:
Flying
Whenever you cycle or discard another card, scry 1.
Cycling {U} ({U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.flavor: To consult a sphinx is a test in patience. Perhaps that's the point.

name: Curfew
text: Each player returns a creature he or she controls to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: ". . . But I'm not tired!"
". . . But I'm not tired!"

name: Curiosity
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor: "Surely you know the joy of the hunt, my furry friend. My kind of hunt just takes a different form than yours."
All Mirri wanted to do was rest, but she couldn't ignore a nagging suspicion as she followed Crovax's skulking form.
"You know that secret? The one that wakes you up at night in a cold sweat? The one you think no one else in the world knows? Well, guess what."
All Mirri wanted to do was rest, but she couldn't ignore a nagging suspicion as she followed Crovax's skulking form.

name: Curious Homunculus
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast an instant or sorcery spell.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are three or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, transform Curious Homunculus.

editions.flavor: "Step right up! Try your hand! It'll thrill the senses and boggle the mind!"

name: Curse Artifact
text:
Enchant artifact
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Curse Artifact deals 2 damage to that player unless he or she sacrifices that artifact.

editions.flavor: Voska feared the artifact had come too easily.

name: Cursebreak
text: Destroy target enchantment. You gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: No longer the village pariah. No longer taunted and shamed. Sigrun was finally free.

name: Cursecatcher
text: Sacrifice Cursecatcher: Counter target instant or sorcery spell unless its controller pays {1}.

editions.flavor: "Of all the things that can be stolen, opportunity is the most valuable."

name: Cursed Flesh
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 and has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

editions.flavor: A farewell to arms . . . and feet . . . and legs . . .
A farewell to arms . . . and feet . . . and legs . . . .
Misery, filth, disease—all things that bring suffering to the world—only make Phyrexians more dangerous.

name: Cursed Land
text:
Enchant land
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, Cursed Land deals 1 damage to that player.

name: Cursed Minotaur
text: Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

editions.flavor:
"Look! That is why we must never waver. That is what awaits us if we fail."
—Djeru, initiate of Tah crop

name: Cursed Monstrosity
text:
Flying
Whenever Cursed Monstrosity becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it unless you discard a land card.

editions.flavor:
"Run away! It's an . . . um . . . run away!"
—Nomad sentry

name: Cursed Rack
text:
As Cursed Rack enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
The chosen player's maximum hand size is four.

editions.flavor: Ashnod invented several torture techniques that could make victims even miles away beg for mercy as if the End had come.
Ashnod invented several torture techniques that could make victims even miles away beg for mercy as if the End had come.
Ashnod invented several torture techniques that could make victims even miles away beg for mercy as if the End had come.

name: Cursed Ronin
text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{B}: Cursed Ronin gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "You are fortunate, my enemy. You have paid the price but once. I never stop paying."

name: Cursed Scroll
text: {3}, {T}: Name a card. Reveal a card at random from your hand. If it's the named card, Cursed Scroll deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

name: Cursed Totem
text: Activated abilities of creatures can't be activated.

editions.flavor:
Pass me from soul to soul, / soldier to herder, herder to beast, beast to soil / until I am everywhere. / Then pass me those souls.
—Totem inscription (translated)

Pass me from soul to soul / soldier to herder, herder to beast, beast to soil / until I am everywhere. / Then pass me those souls.
—Totem inscription (translated)

name: Curse of Bloodletting
text:
Enchant player
If a source would deal damage to enchanted player, it deals double that damage to that player instead.

editions.flavor: It is the demon's mark, an infernal claim on the flesh of the guilty.

name: Curse of Chains
text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of each upkeep, tap enchanted creature.

editions.flavor: The giant's real punishment was the fleeting moment when he was allowed to stand before being dragged down to his knees again.

name: Curse of Chaos
text:
Enchant player
Whenever a player attacks enchanted player with one or more creatures, that attacking player may discard a card. If the player does, he or she draws a card.

editions.flavor:
"Let them cry for mercy. The only one who can hear them is me."
—Siglind the Conqueror

name: Curse of Death's Hold
text:
Enchant player
Creatures enchanted player controls get -1/-1.

editions.flavor: "May you and all your kin waste and wither until your clan is no more!"

name: Curse of Echoes
text:
Enchant player
Whenever enchanted player casts an instant or sorcery spell, each other player may copy that spell and may choose new targets for the copy he or she controls.

name: Curse of Exhaustion
text:
Enchant player
Enchanted player can't cast more than one spell each turn.

editions.flavor:
"I do believe your heresy will prove more difficult now that you have more pressing concerns."
—Bishop Argust

name: Curse of Inertia
text:
Enchant player
Whenever a player attacks enchanted player with one or more creatures, that attacking player may tap or untap target permanent of his or her choice.

editions.flavor:
"As long as I pull the strings, you will dance."
—Tezzeret

name: Curse of Marit Lage
text:
When Curse of Marit Lage enters the battlefield, tap all Islands.
Islands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

editions.flavor:
"Our world has not felt her thundering steps in lifetimes, but Marit Lage's presence is still with us."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Curse of Misfortunes
text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may search your library for a Curse card that doesn't have the same name as a Curse attached to enchanted player, put it onto the battlefield attached to that player, then shuffle your library.

name: Curse of Oblivion
text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, that player exiles two cards from his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: The first step to peace is to learn how to forget.

name: Curse of Predation
text:
Enchant player
Whenever a creature attacks enchanted player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

editions.flavor:
"Hunters feed on the fear of their prey."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Curse of Shallow Graves
text:
Enchant player
Whenever a player attacks enchanted player with one or more creatures, that attacking player may create a tapped 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

name: Curse of Stalked Prey
text:
Enchant player
Whenever a creature deals combat damage to enchanted player, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.

editions.flavor:
"Innocent thorns can fill the air with your bloodscent. Don't stray from the path."
—Elmut, crossway watcher

name: Curse of the Bloody Tome
text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, that player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: After seeing his life's work drip away, the mage decided it was a good time to go crazy.
After seeing his life's work drip away, the mage decided it was a good time to go crazy.

name: Curse of the Cabal
text:
Target player sacrifices half the permanents he or she controls, rounded down.
Suspend 2—{2}{B}{B} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {2}{B}{B} and exile it with two time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, if Curse of the Cabal is suspended, that player may sacrifice a permanent. If he or she does, put two time counters on Curse of the Cabal.

name: Curse of the Fire Penguin
text:
Curse of the Fire Penguin consumes and confuses enchanted creature.
-----
Creature Penguin
Trample
When this creature is put into a graveyard from play, return Curse of the Fire Penguin from your graveyard to play.
6/5

name: Curse of the Forsaken
text:
Enchant player
Whenever a creature attacks enchanted player, its controller gains 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"Purge the damned, for they have no place among the righteous!"
—Seeta of Thraben

name: Curse of the Nightly Hunt
text:
Enchant player
Creatures enchanted player controls attack each turn if able.

editions.flavor: When the moon rises and the bloodlust takes hold, nothing matters but the kill.
When the moon rises and the bloodlust takes hold, nothing matters but the kill.

name: Curse of the Pierced Heart
text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, Curse of the Pierced Heart deals 1 damage to that player.

editions.flavor:
"May your veins weep, and may every vampire take notice."
—Stensian curse

name: Curse of the Swine
text: Exile X target creatures. For each creature exiled this way, its controller creates a 2/2 green Boar creature token.

editions.flavor: Another imminent battle subsided in busy snuffling and carefree rooting.

name: Curse of Thirst
text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, Curse of Thirst deals damage to that player equal to the number of Curses attached to him or her.

editions.flavor:
"May you drink until you drown but never be sated."
—Odila, witch of Morkrut

"May you drink until you drown but never be sated."
—Odila, witch of Morkrut

name: Curse of Vengeance
text:
Enchant player
Whenever enchanted player casts a spell, put a spite counter on Curse of Vengeance.
When enchanted player loses the game, you gain X life and draw X cards, where X is the number of spite counters on Curse of Vengeance.

name: Curse of Wizardry
text:
As Curse of Wizardry enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Whenever a player casts a spell of the chosen color, that player loses 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"We must all push through the pain to heal our world."
—Ayli, Kamsa cleric

"We must all push through the pain to heal our world."
—Ayli, Kamsa cleric

name: Curtain of Light
text:
Cast Curtain of Light only during combat after blockers are declared.
Target unblocked attacking creature becomes blocked. (This spell works on creatures that can't be blocked.)
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Paint gold upon the wind,
Shape the wind into a shield,
And vanish behind the brightness."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

name: Curtains' Call
text:
Undaunted (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each opponent.)
Destroy two target creatures.

editions.flavor:
"We give the audience what they want."
—Juri, proprietor of the Juri Revue

name: Custodian of the Trove
text:
Defender
Custodian of the Trove enters the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor: Silumgar delights in repurposing the treasures of other clans to serve his own ravenous greed.

name: Custodi Lich
text:
When Custodi Lich enters the battlefield, you become the monarch.
Whenever you become the monarch, target player sacrifices a creature.

editions.flavor:
"Keeping order is a task too important to relinquish in death."
—Abrado, Custodi priest

name: Custodi Peacekeeper
text:
Reveal Custodi Peacekeeper as you draft it and note how many cards you've drafted this draft round, including Custodi Peacekeeper.
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature with power less than or equal to the highest number you noted for cards named Custodi Peacekeeper.

name: Custodi Soulbinders
text:
Custodi Soulbinders enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the number of other creatures on the battlefield.
{2}{W}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Custodi Soulbinders: Create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

name: Custodi Soulcaller
text:
Melee (Whenever this creature attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each opponent you attacked with a creature this combat.)
Whenever Custodi Soulcaller attacks, return target creature card with converted mana cost X or less from your graveyard to the battlefield, where X is the number of players you attacked with a creature this combat.

name: Custodi Squire
text:
Flying
Will of the council — When Custodi Squire enters the battlefield, starting with you, each player votes for an artifact, creature, or enchantment card in your graveyard. Return each card with the most votes or tied for most votes to your hand.

name: Custody Battle
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent gains control of this creature unless you sacrifice a land."

editions.flavor: Goblins resolve disputes by splitting everything straight down the middle.

name: Customs Depot
text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card, then discard a card.

editions.flavor: A bribe is always faster than filling out paperwork.

name: Cut
text: Cut deals 4 damage to target creature.

name: Cut the Earthly Bond
text: Return target enchanted permanent to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"The more kami that passed through the veil that separated them from our world, the weaker that veil became, threatening to tear into tatters at the slightest pressure."
—The History of Kamigawa

name: Cut the Tethers
text: For each Spirit, return it to its owner's hand unless that player pays {3}.

editions.flavor:
"You cannot bar the path of gods. You can only divert their journey for a while."
—Sensei Hisoka

name: Cutthroat il-Dal
text: Hellbent — Cutthroat il-Dal has shadow as long as you have no cards in hand. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

editions.flavor: Her blades slashed across the noble's shadow. He scoffed, then fell over dead.

name: Cutthroat Maneuver
text: Up to two target creatures each get +1/+1 and gain lifelink until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Our ambition drives us forward. Together we will claim what is ours, no matter who holds it."

name: Cycle of Life
text: Return Cycle of Life to its owner's hand: Target creature you cast this turn has base power and toughness 0/1 until your next upkeep. At the beginning of your next upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.

editions.flavor: Thus does nature assert herself.

name: Cyclical Evolution
text:
Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Exile Cyclical Evolution with three time counters on it.
Suspend 3—{2}{G} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {2}{G} and exile it with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

name: Cyclone
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a wind counter on Cyclone, then sacrifice Cyclone unless you pay {G} for each wind counter on it. If you pay, Cyclone deals damage equal to the number of wind counters on it to each creature and each player.

name: Cyclone Sire
text:
Flying
When Cyclone Sire dies, you may put three +1/+1 counters on target land you control. If you do, that land becomes a 0/0 Elemental creature with haste that's still a land.

editions.flavor: The rampaging Roil creates life out of the most volatile elements.

name: Cyclonic Rift
text:
Return target nonland permanent you don't control to its owner's hand.
Overload {6}{U} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")

editions.flavor: The Izzet specialize in unnatural disaster.
The Izzet specialize in unnatural disaster.
The Izzet specialize in unnatural disaster.

name: Cyclopean Giant
text: When Cyclopean Giant dies, target land becomes a Swamp. Exile Cyclopean Giant.

editions.flavor: A tomb-eye may remain shut for centuries. It opens when it sees a world as twisted and hollow as the wretch beneath its lid.

name: Cyclopean Mummy
text: When Cyclopean Mummy dies, exile it.

editions.flavor: The ritual of plucking out an eye to gain future sight is but a curse that enables the living to see their own deaths.
The ritual of plucking out an eye to gain future sight is but a curse that enables the living to see their own deaths.

name: Cyclopean Snare
text: {3}, {T}: Tap target creature, then return Cyclopean Snare to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: The spoiled, gluttonous halls of the Orzhov teem with gaudy, needless wealth. Even their security measures are made for beauty first, efficiency second.

name: Cyclopean Tomb
text:
{2}, {T}: Put a mire counter on target non-Swamp land. That land is a Swamp for as long as it has a mire counter on it. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
When Cyclopean Tomb is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, at the beginning of each of your upkeeps for the rest of the game, remove all mire counters from a land that a mire counter was put onto with Cyclopean Tomb but that a mire counter has not been removed from with Cyclopean Tomb.

name: Cyclops Gladiator
text: Whenever Cyclops Gladiator attacks, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature defending player controls. If you do, that creature deals damage equal to its power to Cyclops Gladiator.

name: Cyclops of Eternal Fury
text: Creatures you control have haste.

editions.flavor:
"The anger that festers inside this one is contagious."
—Anthousa of Setessa

The Champion armed herself to face the cyclops, heedless of her companions' despair.
"How will you defeat it with only one spear?" asked young Althemone.
The Champion raised her weapon. "It has but one eye."
—The Theriad

name: Cyclops Tyrant
text:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
Cyclops Tyrant can't block creatures with power 2 or less.

editions.flavor: A single eye, blinded by rage.
From her sunsail tent high above the forest floor, an elf harkener can hear the footfalls of a single creature through the cacophony of Naya's jungle sounds.

name: Cylian Sunsinger
text: {R}{G}{W}: Cylian Sunsinger and each other creature with the same name as it get +3/+3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "The sun shines bright upon the strong."

name: Cystbearer
text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

editions.flavor: Phyrexia strives to simulate natural life, but it can't resist improving on the design.

name: Cytoplast Manipulator
text:
Graft 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{U}, {T}: Gain control of target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it for as long as Cytoplast Manipulator remains on the battlefield.

name: Cytoplast Root-Kin
text:
Graft 4 (This creature enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
When Cytoplast Root-Kin enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each other creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it.
{2}: Move a +1/+1 counter from target creature you control onto Cytoplast Root-Kin.

name: Cytoshape
text: Choose a nonlegendary creature on the battlefield. Target creature becomes a copy of that creature until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Though highly effective at reshaping flesh, these specially bred cytoplasts leave the subject reeking of omnibian mucus."
—Simic research notes

name: Cytospawn Shambler
text:
Graft 6 (This creature enters the battlefield with six +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{G}: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains trample until end of turn.

name: Dack Fayden
text:
+1: Target player draws two cards, then discards two cards.
−2: Gain control of target artifact.
−6: You get an emblem with "Whenever you cast a spell that targets one or more permanents, gain control of those permanents."

name: Dack's Duplicate
text: You may have Dack's Duplicate enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield, except it gains haste and dethrone. (Whenever it attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

name: Daggerback Basilisk
text: Deathtouch

editions.flavor:
"Petrifying gaze, deadly fangs, knifelike dorsal spines, venomous saliva . . . Am I missing anything? . . . Toxic bones? Seriously?"
—Samila, Murasa Expeditionary House

"Petrifying gaze, deadly fangs, knifelike dorsal spines, venomous saliva . . . Am I missing anything? . . . Toxic bones? Seriously?"
—Samila, Murasa Expeditionary House

name: Daggerclaw Imp
text:
Flying
Daggerclaw Imp can't block.

editions.flavor: The Simic use the claws as scalpels, while the Rakdos use them for tattooing and torture. The Gruul use them to pick their teeth after lunching on the rest of the carcass.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic

name: Daggerdrome Imp
text:
Flying
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

editions.flavor: One of the many reasons why open-air markets close at dusk.

name: Daghatar the Adamant
text:
Vigilance
Daghatar the Adamant enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}{B/G}{B/G}: Move a +1/+1 counter from target creature onto a second target creature.

editions.flavor: "Our victories will protect a thousand generations."
"Our victories will protect a thousand generations."

name: Daily Regimen
text:
Enchant creature
{1}{W}: Put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.

editions.flavor: What self-indulgence tears down, discipline builds up again.
What self-indulgence tears down, discipline builds up again.

name: Dakkon Blackblade
text: Dakkon Blackblade's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.

editions.flavor: "My power is as vast as the plains, my strength is that of mountains. Each wave that crashes upon the shore thunders like blood in my veins." —Memoirs

"My power is as vast as the plains, my strength is that of mountains. Each wave that crashes upon the shore thunders like blood in my veins."
—Dakkon Blackblade, Memoirs

"My power is as vast as the plains; my strength is that of mountains. Each wave that crashes upon the shore thunders like blood in my veins."
—Dakkon Blackblade, Memoirs

name: Dakkon Blackblade Avatar
text: You may play any colored card from your hand as a copy of a basic land card chosen at random that can produce mana of one of the card's colors.

editions.flavor: MED Participation Avatar

name: Dakmor Bat
text: Flying

editions.flavor: The bat thrives on what underestimates it.

name: Dakmor Ghoul
text: When Dakmor Ghoul enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor:
"Cursed be the sickly forms that err from honest Nature's rule!"
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "Locksley Hall"

name: Dakmor Lancer
text: When Dakmor Lancer enters the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature.

editions.flavor: The darkness of his shield reflects the inky blackness of his soul.
The darkness of his shield reflects the inky blackness of his soul.

name: Dakmor Plague
text: Dakmor Plague deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.

editions.flavor: The tiniest cough can be deadlier than the fiercest dragon.
The tiniest cough can be deadlier than the fiercest dragon.
The tiniest cough can be deadlier than the fiercest dragon.

name: Dakmor Salvage
text:
Dakmor Salvage enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly two cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)
